project-basis: Built on top of Twilio, Amazon Web Services--especially the Api Gateway and Lambda functions, and a host of APIs, the bot is an interconnected mesh of software services.
project-challenges: Challenges... lots... at first designing a chatbot seemed like it would be simple: no UI, no problem! If only that were true.  I really liked the idea of pointing a camera at a beer and getting back information about what you were looking at. Triangulating this data was by far the most challenging aspect.
project-future-plans: I'd love to try it out. Get some friends to use it. Figure out the data on what people drink in what neighborhoods and make a map of that.
project-purpose: 1-657-BEER-BOT is a SMS + Camera + Web experience.
project-inspiration: I once heard that in ancient Rome people were able to wayfind by sampling the water. Apparently each well tasted slightly differently and after awhile you knew what part of town you were in by how metallic the water tasted.
project-lessons-learned: I think my next chatbot I'll approach with a UX flow in mind first. Even though there are no "pixels", I didn't give that part of the project enough thought. I looked at Eliza and some of the other chatbots, but they all seem to have a particular way of seeing the world that seemed more complicated than I needed it to bet.
project-accomplishments: Well, you know, pulling it all together. It seems to work!
project-subtitle: I'm not sitting at the bar alone. I'm txt'ing and learning about with my pal: 1-657-BEER-BOT.
